channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Massive dog poo, 22nd January
item.description:
Once again someone has let their massive dog poo on my grass verge right where we park our cars. This is not the first time and is a recurring problem. Despite a sign up asking people to clean up and that they are on camera they still do it. Please can it be cleared away and signs put up. Otherwise I am going to put paving slabs down. Fed up of having to dodge massive piles of s*** whenever I go out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stuart Mantle Way, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Upturned recycling bin, 22nd January
item.description:
This recycling bin was upturned by the bin men weeks ago and it was left full, upside down meaning the council buildings have one fewer recycling bins. This is causing rubbish to build up. The bin men have not attempted to empty the upside down bin and it cannot be moved by tenants due to the size and weight. Please send the council to fix this.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Creek Road, Deptford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Various items being dumped, pests such as rats gathering at the site, 22nd January
item.description:
Hi, Various items are being dumped in the pathway (grass verge) that I have pinpointed in the location. This is the abandoned area next to Belvedere park development DA17, next to the pumping station. I believe there might be some food items as rats have started going through the various bin bags. Children walk the path frequently so this has become a health and safety issue. It has been going on for months but recently somebody has dumped a lot of bin bags and even trolleys. Can we please get somebody to clear some of the fly tipping? Especially the trolleys and the bin bags which is bringing rats .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yarnton Way, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Southwood road, 22nd January
item.description:
This has been reported before but nothing done?? As you can see the pavement is covered with leaves and dirt over half way across the pavement which is dangerous for the children leaving school . If this was cleaned it might help stop people dumping more rubbish on top of this mess. No good sending that road sweeper at 8.00 in the morning like you do because all the cars are still parked up and all he cleans is the middle of the road. The pavement needs a proper clean both sides of the road. Many thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woolf Close, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain cover put back incorrectly, 22nd January
item.description:
Today 22/1/26, workman were dealing with an issue regarding the drain in the street outside my property and another neighbour s property. When they had gone I noticed that they had not put the drain cover back correctly causing it to protrude. My main concern is someone tripping or having a fall.

Report on FixMyStreet
